abstract.p: Philippine prosecutors, citing lack of evidence, drop charges against 23-year-old bank employee Onel de Guzman in connection with destructive 'I Love You' computer virus swept Internet via E-mail messages in May (S)

block.p: Citing lack of evidence, Philippine prosecutors dropped charges against a 23-year-old bank employee in connection with the destructive computer program that swept the Internet in self-propagating ''I Love You'' e-mail messages last month. Reonel Ramones, who lived in the apartment where investigators suspected the program originated, had been charged under a law prohibiting unauthorized use of passwords for credit cards or bank accounts. But it was another resident of the apartment, Onel de Guzman, 21, who said he might have inadvertently released the program, commonly called a virus or worm. Mr. de Guzman has not been charged.
